column5: I've lost the thread with a Canadian website that list baits that cannot be taken into Canada. Anyone have it? Can't find any information on the MNR website either. FarmKing has preserved Shad prepackaged that looks to be a good Lake trout bait, but I don't know if I can take it over the border. Any quick help? Pooch
no live minnows or live leeches. Worms ok if in bedding, (not in soil).
Not sure, but aren't frozen or live smelt banned in some places?Al

I'm pretty sure frozen smelt are banned, and live for sure. Not sure about preserved. Four Seasons usually has frozen cisco if you're going that way, Pooch. We have had good luck just using bigger minnows on spinner rigs if we can't find cisco.

Legal Ontario bait:http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business...ge/198684.htmlIs this the site you were looking for?Also there is a paper that says if it the bait is not listed it is illegal seehttp://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/STEL02_178932.pdfHope this helps, don't shoot the messenger.
